title: What is the effectiveness of executive education? - Quora

response.answer_text: In an increasingly complex global business environment, individuals continuously look for ways to stay ahead of the crowd and make meaningful change, for them Executive education becomes important. An executive education can be either skill based or leadership based and one can choose depending upon the requirement. In skill based executive education, its pretty easy to gauge the effectiveness of the executive education but Leadership based programs it can be difficult to estimate as there are number of factors which can come into play. Many top companies utilize a variety of approaches to develop their executives, including mentoring, coaching, on-the-job training, and rotation assignments; executive education is typically only a small part of the equation. From an L&D perspective you can use Donald Kirkpatrick’s classic four levels, first published over 50 years ago for executive program evaluation: Reaction—What was the participant level of satisfaction with the program experience?Learning—What did they learn? Did they increase their knowledge, skills, or capabilities?Behavior—What changes in behavior resulted from application of the learning?Results—What was the impact on the business of their performance back on the job?

My experiences are primarily at Harvard Business School, which I would rave about, particularly the Owner/ President Management Program. I also went to a two day course at MIT Sloan. Several of my team have done short programs at Darden and Wharton. Never stop learning. Exec Ed is a great way to network while building excellent business skills. HBS OPM has been a life changing experience for me.
